intro: Iberis ciliata subsp. linifolia, commonly known as the Armenian rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom in early spring. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardiness and visual interest.
